Class java.Nutmeg.Collection

Welcome to THOUGHT Inc.

 
Nutmeg Class Hierarchy  Method Names





  Class java.Nutmeg.Collection



java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.Nutmeg.Collection






  
 public class Collection
  
 extends Object
  
 implements Cloneable clase for all Nutmeg collection classes).

Each collection tries to optimize storage management by maintaining
a capacity and a growSize. The capacity is always at
least as large as the collection size; it is usually larger because
as objects are added to the collection, the collection's
storage increases in chunks the size of growSize. Setting
the capacity to what you want before inserting a large number of
objects will reduce the amount of incremental reallocation.
You can safely ignore the capacity and the collection will still work
correctly.





  




  
 
	growSize
  
 The size of the increment.
  
 
	objectCount
  
 The number of objects.
  
 
	objectData
  
 The buffer.
  
 
	useJavaExceptions
  
 Determine if we use Java Exceptions or return null ala Smalltalk
when a failure occurs.
  
 
	versionNumber
  
 The version of the class library.




  




  
 
	Collection(int, int)
  
 Constructor for Collection with an initial storage capacity
and a specified growSize.
  
 
	Collection(int)
  
 Constructs an empty Collection with the specified storage capacity, and
a default capacity increment.
  
 
	Collection()
  
 Construct an empty Collection.




  




  
 
	add(Object)
  
 Add an object to the collection.
  
 
	addAll(Collection)
  
 Add all members of the collection col to the current collection.
  
 
	at(int)
  
 Access the member at the index position anInt in the collection

  
 
	capacity()
  
 Returns the current capacity of the Collection, this is not only the
number of objects contained, but also the free space available.
  
 
	clone()
  
 Clone this collection.
  
 
	collect(DoBlock)
  
 Return a collection of objects which cause a true return code as
parameters to the doBlock.
  
 
	deepCopy()
  
 Return a new collection of objects each of which has been deep copied
(or in Java terminology - cloned).
  
 
	detect(DoBlock)
  
 Return the first member of the collection which produces a true
return code as the parameter to the doBlock.
  
 
	detect(DoBlock, DoBlock)
  
 Return the first member of the collection which produces a true
return code as the parameter to the doBlock.
  
 
	doBlock(DoBlock)
  
 Execute the doBlock on each object of the collection.
  
 
	doBlock(DoBlock, DoBlock)
  
 Execute the doBlock on each object of the collection, and execute the
separatorBlock between each member of the collection.
  
 
	ensureCapacity(int)
  
 Ensures that the collection has at least the specified capacity, and if
it doesn't, then the storage will be increased to accomodate.
  
 
	includes(Object)
  
 Return true if the receiver contains an object which equals anObject
as one of its objects, else answer false.

 Searches for the specified object, starting from the first position
and returns an index to it.

 Searches for the specified object, starting from the specified position

 Searches backwards for the specified object, starting from the specified

 Return a new collection with only those objects which produce a

versionNumber

  public String versionNumber




  
 The version of the class library.



objectData

  protected Object objectData[]




  
 The buffer.



useJavaExceptions

  protected boolean useJavaExceptions




  
 Determine if we use Java Exceptions or return null ala Smalltalk
when a failure occurs.



objectCount

  protected int objectCount




  
 The number of objects.



growSize

  protected int growSize




  
 The size of the increment. If it is 0 the size of the
the buffer is doubled everytime it needs to grow.





  




Collection

  public Collection(int initialSize,
                    int growSize)




  
 Constructor for Collection with an initial storage capacity
and a specified growSize.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage
    
 growSize - the increment that storage should grow by
size doubles if value is 0.
  




Collection

  public Collection(int initialSize)




  
 Constructs an empty Collection with the specified storage capacity, and
a default capacity increment.  Capacity increment is defaulted to 0
using this constructor.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage.
  




Collection

  public Collection()




  
 Construct an empty Collection.  This defaults to an initial storage
capacity of 10 objects, and a growSize of 0.





  



add

  public synchronized Object add(Object anObject)




  
 Add an object to the collection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the object to be added to the collection
    
 Returns:
    
 anObject the Object which was added.
  




addAll

  public synchronized void addAll(Collection aCollection)




  
 Add all members of the collection col to the current collection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 aCollection - the collection containing the objects to be added to 
the collection.
  




at

  public Object at(int anInt)




  
 Access the member at the index position anInt in the collection
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anInt - the integer position of the object.
    
 Returns:
    
 Object at position anInt, otherwise return null
    
 Throws: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
    
 anInt is not within the valid
range of values for the Collection.
  




includes

  public boolean includes(Object anObject)




  
 Return true if the receiver contains an object which equals anObject
as one of its objects, else answer false.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the Object to be looked up.
    
 Returns:
    
 true if anObject found, or false if not
  




notEmpty

  public final boolean notEmpty()




  
 Check if the receiver contains any objects.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 true if contains objects, false if none contained.
  




occurrencesOf

  public synchronized int occurrencesOf(Object anObject)




  
 Return true if the receiver contains an object which equals anObject
as one of its objects, else answer false.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the Object to be looked up.
    
 Returns:
    
 number of occurrences of anObject in Collection.
  




remove

  public final synchronized boolean remove(Object anObject)




  
 Return true if the receiver contains an object which equals anObject
and the object is removed from the list.  If anObject is not found
then return false, and no objects are removed.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the Object to be removed.
    
 Returns:
    
 true if anObject is found and removed, false if not.
  




removeAll

  public final synchronized void removeAll()




  
 Remove all objects from the list.



removeAll

  public final synchronized void removeAll(Collection aCollection)




  
 Remove all objects contained in aCollection from the list.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 aCollection - the Collection containing objects to be removed.
  




collect

  public final synchronized Collection collect(DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Return a collection of objects which cause a true return code as
parameters to the doBlock.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed.
    
 Returns:
    
 a Collection which contains all of the objects which cause
a true return condition from the doBlock.
  




deepCopy

  public synchronized Collection deepCopy()




  
 Return a new collection of objects each of which has been deep copied
(or in Java terminology - cloned).
WARNING! Due to the current definition of the clone() method of
class Object being protected instead of public, a deepCopy cannot
be implemented!  The results of this call return a shallow, and
NOT a deep copy.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 a collection with a reference to all of the objects.
  




detect

  public final Object detect(DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Return the first member of the collection which produces a true
return code as the parameter to the doBlock.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed.
    
 Returns:
    
 the object which causes true return from doBlock, or null if
none of them caused a true condition.
  




detect

  public final Object detect(DoBlock doBlock,
                             DoBlock exceptionBlock)




  
 Return the first member of the collection which produces a true
return code as the parameter to the doBlock.  If no matches are
found then call doBlock method on the exception block.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed.
    
 exceptionBlock - the Exception Block which is to be executed if
no matching objects are found.
    
 Returns:
    
 the object which causes true return from doBlock, or null if
none of them caused a true condition.
  




doBlock

  public void doBlock(DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Execute the doBlock on each object of the collection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed on each member.
  




doBlock

  public final void doBlock(DoBlock doBlock,
                            DoBlock separatorBlock)




  
 Execute the doBlock on each object of the collection, and execute the
separatorBlock between each member of the collection.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed on each member.
    
 separatorBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed between each 
member.
  




reject

  public synchronized Collection reject(DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Return a new collection with only those objects which produce a
false return code from the doBlock execution.  This is a shallow copy.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed on each member.
    
 Returns:
    
 a new collection with a copy of the objects rejected.
  




select

  public synchronized Collection select(DoBlock doBlock)




  
 Return a new collection with only those objects which produce a
true return code from the doBlock execution.  This is a shallow copy.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed on each member.
    
 Returns:
    
 a new collection with a copy of the objects selected.
  




shallowCopy

  public synchronized Collection shallowCopy()




  
 Return a new collection with a reference to all members in the
current collection.  This is a shallow copy because members are not
cloned, but only referenced.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 doBlock - the Do Block which is to be executed on each member.
    
 Returns:
    
 a new collection with a copy of the objects
  




trimToSize

  public final synchronized void trimToSize()




  
 Trims the Collection's capacity down to size. Use this operation to
minimize the storage of a collection. Inserting another object will
then cause the collection to grow based on the capacity increment.
This extension was added because we thought it would be a useful
addition for those who are memory conscious programmers.



ensureCapacity

  protected final synchronized void ensureCapacity(int minimumCapacity)




  
 Ensures that the collection has at least the specified capacity, and if
it doesn't, then the storage will be increased to accomodate.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 minimumCapacity - the desired minimum capacity
  




useJavaExceptionHandling

  public final synchronized void useJavaExceptionHandling()




  
 Set the exception handling method of the Collection to use Java
Style Exception Handling (Throw real exceptions).
The Class defaults to using the Java exception handling mechanism,
so this method is convenience method to reverse the 
useSmalltalkExceptionHandlding method.



useSmalltalkExceptionHandling

  public final synchronized void useSmalltalkExceptionHandling()




  
 Set the exception handling method of the Collection to use Smalltalk
Style Exception Handling (Use Exception Class).
The Class defaults to using the Java exception handling mechanism,
so this method is convenience method to reverse the 
useSmalltalkExceptionHandlding method.



usingJavaExceptionHandling

  public final synchronized boolean usingJavaExceptionHandling()




  
 Returns whether or not this Class is currently using the Java Style
Exception Handling.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 whether or not we are using Java Style Exception Handling,
true means Java Style, false means Smalltalk Style.
  




setSize

  public final synchronized void setSize(int newSize)




  
 Set the size of the Collection. If the size shrinks, the Collection
is truncated and the extra objects (at the end of the Collection) 
are lost; if the size increases, the new objects are set to null.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 newSize - the desired size of the collection.
  




capacity

  public final int capacity()




  
 Returns the current capacity of the Collection, this is not only the
number of objects contained, but also the free space available.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 the amount of storage allocated.
  




size

  public final int size()




  
 Returns the number of objects in the Collection.
Note that this is not the same as the Collection's capacity, but is
only the number of objects referenced.
This is an extension to allow easy access to the capacity.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 the number of objects in the collection.
  




isEmpty

  public final boolean isEmpty()




  
 Returns true if the collection contains no values.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 true if empty, false if not.
  




objects

  public final synchronized Enumeration objects()




  
 Returns an enumeration of the objects. Use the Enumeration methods on
the returned object to fetch the objects sequentially.
This is an extension to the API to take advantage of Java's Enumeration
class.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 an enumeration of the objects.
  




indexOf

  public final int indexOf(Object anObject)




  
 Searches for the specified object, starting from the first position
and returns an index to it.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the desired object
    
 Returns:
    
 the index of the object, or -1 if it was not found
  




indexOf

  public final synchronized int indexOf(Object anObject,
                                        int anInt)




  
 Searches for the specified object, starting from the specified position
and return an index to it.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the desired object to search for
    
 anInt - the index where to start searching
    
 Returns:
    
 the index of the object, or -1 if it was not found
  




lastIndexOf

  public final int lastIndexOf(Object anObject)




  
 Searches backwards for the specified object, starting from the last
position and returns an index to it.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the desired object
    
 Returns:
    
 the index of the object, or -1 if it was not found
  




lastIndexOf

  public final synchronized int lastIndexOf(Object anObject,
                                            int anInt)




  
 Searches backwards for the specified object, starting from the specified
position and returns an index to it.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the desired object
    
 anInt - the index where to start searching
    
 Returns:
    
 the index of the object, or -1 if it was not found
  




lastObject

  public final synchronized Object lastObject()




  
 Returns the last object of the sequence.
  

    
 Throws: NoSuchCollectionMember
    
 The sequence is empty.
  




setObjectAt

  public final synchronized void setObjectAt(Object anObject,
                                             int anInt)




  
 Sets the object at the specified index to be the specified object.
The previous object at that position is discarded.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the object to be placed at anInt
    
 anInt - the index where to start searching
    
 Throws: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
    
 Invalid index
  




removeObjectAt

  public final synchronized void removeObjectAt(int anInt)




  
 Deletes the object at the specified index. Objects with an index
greater than index are moved down.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anInt - the object to remove
    
 Throws: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
    
 Invalid index
  




insertObjectAt

  public final synchronized void insertObjectAt(Object anObject,
                                                int anInt)




  
 Inserts the specified object as an object at the specified index.
Objects with an index greater or equal to the index are shifted up.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the object to insert
    
 anInt - where to insert the new object
    
 Throws: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
    
 invalid index
  




removeObject

  public final synchronized boolean removeObject(Object anObject)




  
 Removes the object from the collection. If the object occurs more
than once, only the first is removed. If the object is not an
object, returns false.
  

    
 Parameters:
    
 anObject - the object to be removed
    
 Returns:
    
 true if the object was actually removed
  




removeAllObjects

  public final synchronized void removeAllObjects()




  
 Removes all objects of the collection. The collection becomes empty.



clone

  public synchronized Object clone()




  
 Clone this collection. The objects are not cloned.
  

    
 Returns:
    
 a new Object identical to the current one.
    
 Overrides:
    
 clone in class Object
